Dgame.Graphics.Text



class Text: Dgame.Graphics.Transformable.Transformable, Dgame.Graphics.Template.Blendable.Blendable, Dgame.Graphics.Drawable.Drawable;
Text defines a graphical 2D text, that can be drawn on screen. - The default foreground color is Color.Black - The default background color is Color.White

Author:
rschuett

this(ref Font font, string text = "");
CTor

final void update();
Activate an update. The current image will be updated. In most cases, this happens automatically, but sometimes it is usefull.

void format(Args...)(string text, Args args);
Format a given string and draw it then on the image

final void opCall(string text);
Replace the current string.

Examples:
Font fnt = new Font("samples/font/arial.ttf", 12);
Text t = new Text(font);
t("My new string");


final void opCall(ref const Text t);
Replace the current string.

Examples:
Font fnt = new Font("samples/font/arial.ttf", 12);
Text t1 = new Text(font);
Text t2 = new Text(font);
t1("My new string");
t2(t1); // now both t's draw 'My new string' on screen.


Text opBinary(string op)(string text);
Concatenate the current string with another.

Examples:
Font fnt = new Font("samples/font/arial.ttf", 12);
Text t = new Text(font);
t("My new string");
t ~= "is great!"; // t draws now 'My new string is great' on screen.
The example above is the same as if you do: 
t += "is great!";
Both operators (~ and +) are allowed.

Text opBinary(string op)(ref const Text t);
Concatenate the current string with another.

final const pure nothrow string getString();
Returns the current string.
